availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Aaron Benjamin Fontaine (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, attorney and notary)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, attorney and notary. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Fontaine. Father of Edward Fontaine, Ogden Fontaine, Noland Fontaine, Emeline Fontaine, and Mary Fontaine. Attorney in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Louisville in 1860. Notary Public in Louisville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 3, p. 253B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 6, p. 343.
"Aaron Benjamin Fontaine (1811-1880)," Find A Grave, Memorial 68610717, accessed October 12, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68610717.
